holidays.name: National Chocolate Chip Day
holidays.description: A sweet celebration dedicated to one of the most beloved cookie ingredients—the chocolate chip! Perfect day to bake and indulge in chocolatey treats.
holidays.origin: Created in the U.S. to honor the invention of the chocolate chip cookie by Ruth Wakefield in the 1930s.
holidays.funFact: Ruth Wakefield invented the chocolate chip cookie by accident when she ran out of baker's chocolate and chopped up a bar of semi-sweet chocolate instead.

holidays.name: International Day of Families
holidays.description: A day to recognize and promote the importance of families around the world, focusing on issues such as family stability, education, and social welfare.
holidays.origin: Established by the United Nations in 1993 to highlight the role of families in development and society.
holidays.funFact: Each year the UN announces a special theme for the International Day of Families to address different challenges families face globally.

holidays.name: National Pack Rat Day
holidays.description: For all the collectors, hoarders, and memory keepers—this day encourages celebrating your inner pack rat while also considering decluttering!
holidays.origin: An unofficial holiday celebrating the quirky habit of holding on to keepsakes, trinkets, and random treasures.
holidays.funFact: Being a ‘pack rat’ isn't always negative; psychological studies show that saving mementos can boost happiness and memory.

holidays.name: World Penguin Day
holidays.description: A fun and educational day to raise awareness about penguin species, their habitats, and conservation efforts worldwide.
holidays.origin: Celebrates the annual northward migration of penguins that starts in mid-May each year.
holidays.funFact: Despite their flightless nature, penguins are excellent swimmers, reaching speeds up to 15 mph in the water!
